description:
This market will resolve to "Higher" if the price of Bitcoin ($BTC) is higher 24 hours after the time of the halving than it was at the time of the halving. This market will resolve to "Lower" if the price of $BTC is lower 24 hours after the time of the halving. This market will resolve to 50-50 if the price of $BTC is exactly the same 24 hours after the time of the halving.

The price of $BTC at time of halving is defined herein as the "C" price (when the "Price" tab and "24h" is selected) listed on https://www.binance.com/en/trade/BTC_USDT for the candle covering the 1 minute window during which the halving occurs. Note that the candles are titled and dated with the closing second, and cover the 1 minute preceding their title.

This market will resolve according to the “C” (when the "Price" tab is selected and "1m" is selected, on https://www.binance.com/en/trade/BTC_USDT) listed for the candle exactly 24 hours after the candle containing the halving timestamp. For example, if the halving occurred within the 1 minute candle titled "2024/04/19 09:00:00", then the market will resolve based on the "C" price of the "2024/04/20 09:00:00" candle.

events.title: Bitcoin price 24 hours after halving?

question: Bitcoin price 24 hours after halving?
